ProjectTitle: Advanced Nanomaterials for Cancer Phototherapies in 3D Cell Models
InitialFeedbackHistory: 13/06/2024 [REDACTED] will you use samples/materials? [REDACTED] are considered physical data in the context of a DMP, please list these the table and describe how you document, store and preserve these. [REDACTED] you use human bodily materiaal which include human cells? [REDACTED] that case please make sure to register the use at the UZL EC [REDACTED] see https://research.kuleuven.be/en/associatienet/ethics/guidance/humanmaterial; answer yes to the question whether there are ethical issues and add the approval (S)-number. [REDACTED] please note that the KU [REDACTED] RDM policy aks for 10 years preservation of all relevant data: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/policy; you can always contact your local IT team or rdm-icts@kuleuven.be to discuss whether there are more economical long term storage solutions available. [REDACTED] please note that [REDACTED] is not suitable for data sharing, for this purpose you can use RDR: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr or another (disciplinary) data repository, for more information see: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/data-sharing
